abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Improvement
            Project in Lithuania were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            low or negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was highly satisfactory.
            Lessons learned included: 1) The importance of continuous
            Government ownership and capacity building at the local
            level; 2) The directors and key staff of the departments of
            the Ministry of Education and Science (MES) not only stayed
            in their positions and but also showed strong performance
            throughout the Project; 3) Establishing the institutional
            and legal arrangements for the implementation at the outset.
            This is a common sense requirement for any project, but is
            not so easy to do in practice; 4) The importance of public
            consultation; 5) The quality of technical assistance has
            been good and their work has been well targeted to develop
            the capacity of the MES; 6) The benefit of thorough project
            preparation; 7) There should be balance between physical
            investment and institutional capacity building; and 8) The
            Government appreciated the Bank's technical advice
            during Project preparation and implementation more so than
            its financial resources.

abstracts.cdata!:
In an aim to improve student achievement
            in basic education, and to make a more efficient use of
            financial, human, and physical resources, the Education
            Improvement Project, will support municipalities in
            optimizing school networks, improving energy and space
            utilization, in an initial group of targeted schools. The
            components will: 1) enhance the quality of teaching and
            learning in basic schools, by upgrading teaching skills,
            through active learning strategies, cooperation-based
            methods, and alternative student assessment practices.
            Teaching equipment will be updated in accordance with new
            curriculum demands, and through the use of information and
            communication technologies. Education quality management
            will be enhanced through a Policy Analysis, focused on
            providing reliable information for policy formulation; 2)
            upgrade school facilities, by improving energy efficiency,
            hygiene conditions, and access for the handicapped. School
            networks within municipalities will be optimized, by
            simultaneously improving the quality of teaching and
            learning, through capacity building to local governments,
            and through the establishment of monitoring systems, and
            quality improvement programs; and, 3) support project
            coordination with the Ministry of Education and Science
            (MES), educational institutions, and municipalities. It
            includes procurement, finance, and administrative support.

repnme.cdata!:
Lithuania - education improvement Project :
            environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental management plan
            outlines the mitigation measures that are proposed to
            alleviate expected negative impacts caused by the Lithuania
            Education Improvement Project, which enhances the quality of
            teaching and learning, and upgrades school facilities.
            Before and during renovation works, survey and identify
            hazardous building materials, humidity-caused damage, and
            possible contaminated land. If asbestos or other hazardous
            substance is found, create a demolition and disposal plan.
            Recycle and sort construction waste, and use officially
            approved disposal sites. Create a decontamination plan if
            the survey identifies contaminated land. Use insulation and
            building materials that are environmentally safe and
            commonly found. Check the quality of the pipe works, and use
            coal that ensures the cleanliness and functionality of the
            ventilation system. Lastly monitor energy and water consumption.

docna.cdata!:
Lithuania - education improvement Project :
